conclusion: Analyzing problem to find static friction force on block D
Four identical wooden blocks on smooth surface, B and C connected by spring, force F applied to B, all blocks accelerate with same acceleration, find static friction on D
Block D stacked on C, Block A stacked on B, B and C connected by spring, force F applied to B, all blocks move with same acceleration
Define variables: m = mass of each block, a = acceleration, F = force on B, F_spring = spring force, F_D = static friction on D
Total force on Block B: F - F_spring = m·a
Total force on Block C: F_spring = m·a
Total force on Block D: F_D = m·a
Total force on Block A: F_A = m·a (not directly relevant)
From Block B: F - F_spring = m·a
Substitute: F - m·a = m·a, F = 2m·a, a = F/(2m)
Calculate static friction on D: F_D = m·a = m·(F/(2m)) = F/2
Static friction force on block D is F/2
